channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Young voters’ elation for Harris may be plateauing. And, redefining 'conservative'
item.description: Harris initially generated renewed enthusiasm as a presidential candidate, but that may be leveling off among young voters. And, a rural family is redefining what it means to be conservative.
item.content:encoded:
Harris initially generated renewed enthusiasm as a presidential candidate, but that may be leveling off among young voters. And, a rural family is redefining what it means to be conservative.

(Image credit: Dominic Gwinn)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The story of the American migrant — from Dust Bowl to a new life
item.description: Pat Rush and her family left Arkansas in the wake of one of the largest migrations in U.S. history, in the hope of making a better life for themselves out west.
item.content:encoded:
Pat Rush and her family left Arkansas in the wake of one of the largest migrations in U.S. history, in the hope of making a better life for themselves out west.

(Image credit: Pat Rush)
item.dc:creator: Joe Richman

item.title: Youth cheerleading is getting more athletic — and riskier
item.description: As the female-dominated sport gets more acrobatic, girls are racking up more concussions and other injuries. A new pediatricians' report calls for change.
item.content:encoded:
As the female-dominated sport gets more acrobatic, girls are racking up more concussions and other injuries. A new pediatricians' report calls for change.

(Image credit: Harold Hoch/MediaNews Group/Reading Eagle)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Texas attorney general's statement rejects supporters of death row inmate's appeal
item.description: The statement from Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton "corrects falsehoods" from critics who say death row inmate Robert Roberson was unjustifiably convicted in the death of his toddler child.
item.content:encoded:
The statement from Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton "corrects falsehoods" from critics who say death row inmate Robert Roberson was unjustifiably convicted in the death of his toddler child.

(Image credit: Tony Gutierrez/AP)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Want to understand the dramatic shift in Latino views on abortion? Go to Arizona
item.description: Arizona has seen rising support for abortion rights among Latinos. The reasons are varied and complicated.
item.content:encoded:
Arizona has seen rising support for abortion rights among Latinos. The reasons are varied and complicated.

(Image credit: Keren Carrión/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Noah Caldwell

item.title: Senior sprinter Julia 'Hurricane' Hawkins dies at 108
item.description: Hawkins became a darling of the track and field world when she took up running at 100 years old. She died in Baton Rouge, La., this week.
item.content:encoded:
Hawkins became a darling of the track and field world when she took up running at 100 years old. She died in Baton Rouge, La., this week.

(Image credit: Brit Huckabay courtesy of the National Senior Games Association)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Some colleges are targeting financial aid to middle-class families
item.description: Many middle-income families are frustrated by the cost of higher education, feeling they earn too much for financial aid, but not enough to pay for it themselves.
item.content:encoded:
Many middle-income families are frustrated by the cost of higher education, feeling they earn too much for financial aid, but not enough to pay for it themselves.

(Image credit: Sofia Aldinio)
item.dc:creator: Jon Marcus

item.title: A Pennsylvania farming family redefines 'conservative'
item.description: On a visit to a sprawling history-rich farmer's market and a family farm, NPR asks people with agricultural and rural interests, what's on your mind as you cast your vote?
item.content:encoded:
On a visit to a sprawling history-rich farmer's market and a family farm, NPR asks people with agricultural and rural interests, what's on your mind as you cast your vote?

(Image credit: Hannah Yoon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Destinee Adams

item.title: A Good Guy: 279 Hours
item.description: "Have you ever tried to overthrow the U.S. government?" Marine Sgt. Joshua Abate was in the middle of a routine polygraph test to receive top-secret clearance when he made an extraordinary admission: He had followed the crowd that broke into the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. This admission leads to a different kind of January 6 story. Abate says he's not an insurrectionist. So why did it take him so long to talk openly about that day? To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.
item.content:encoded: "Have you ever tried to overthrow the U.S. government?" Marine Sgt. Joshua Abate was in the middle of a routine polygraph test to receive top-secret clearance when he made an extraordinary admission: He had followed the crowd that broke into the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. This admission leads to a different kind of January 6 story. Abate says he's not an insurrectionist. So why did it take him so long to talk openly about that day? To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: 'Los Angeles Times' editor resigns after newspaper withholds presidential endorsement
item.description: The editorials editor of the LA Times resigned after the newspaper’s owner blocked the editorial board’s plans to endorse Vice President Harris for president, a journalism trade publication reported.
item.content:encoded:
The editorials editor of the LA Times resigned after the newspaper’s owner blocked the editorial board’s plans to endorse Vice President Harris for president, a journalism trade publication reported.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
